utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: Bye

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I… I want to be alone… with my wife. I’m a selfish S.O.B. I… I never got you to Rio. There was always… one more problem at the stores. You deserved better than that.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: I love you. I always have.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I’m ready.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: It’s okay. I know…

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Somebody… Help her. Help her!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: 54-year-old woman with acute respiratory failure. No anaphylaxis, lung issues or tracheal lesions. Tox screen was clean for coke and amphetamines.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I will give you 30 reasons, one for each pound that cause the apnea which enflamed the epiglottis. Why is our rainbow coalition missing brown and bi?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thirteen’s with a patient, and Kutner’s dog’s sick. He should be in by lunch.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No apnea because no sleeping problems when she’s sleeping. She spent the last six months caring for her husband who’s dying of heart failure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Reason 31 — whatever whacked the husband’s heart is also whacking her airway and… Oh, good. I thought maybe Kutner was home nursing the rib you broke when you elbowed your way in for credit on the last patient.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I contributed. And the patient’s illness wasn’t caused by her husband unless lung cancer’s contagious.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting. Not about the patient. That was kinda dull. I thought maybe you were lying to cover for Kutner which sounds noble. Except you’re doing it out of guilt instead of love.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She visited her sister in Hawaii about six months ago, just before her husband got sick.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Could have picked up melioidosis from one of the islands.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Would have jumped to the husband and finished off him and his lame immune system.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No tumors, no drugs, no bacteria. Leaves viral — varicella zoster.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Start her on IV fluids and acyclovir.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Can’t. She’s demanding to be released so she can get home to her husband.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How sweet. They can die together instead of separately, 40 years apart.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She claims he got stronger as soon as she stopped breathing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The mind can heal the body. Seeing his wife in distress might have actually slowed down his death.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or he could have just had an adrenaline surge when he saw his chance to hit the singles market. Send her home.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We don’t need to. I had an idea… All by myself.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: Eddie?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Found him loitering in the lobby.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: You’re still with me.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Where the hell else am I gonna go?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And now, with your permission, we’d like to try to make you better.

utterance.speaker: Mother
utterance.content: The pageant starts in an hour. You have to do something. There’s something wrong inside her head. It’s like she has no idea what’s going on around her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I thought she was just flirting with me. I can fix it, but it’s gonna cost you… $3.75. I’m not just gonna give you my coffee. Think of it as Costa Rican sober juice.

utterance.speaker: Mother
utterance.content: She’s drunk?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That little minty scent hiding beneath the rose petal perfume and the cherry blossom moisturizer and the morning dew hair spray. You sneak into mommy’s bathroom and gulp some of her mouthwash?

utterance.speaker: Daughter
utterance.content: Gotta be perfect.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You spit it out?

utterance.speaker: Daughter
utterance.content: Mommy doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Treatment worked. Charlotte’s breathing’s back to normal. She’s being discharged.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She can resume her vigil over her husband who started fading again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Win some, lose some. And strictly speaking, since he’s not my patient, win some. Look at the time. It’s half past “Taub was lying about Kutner.”

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He probably went to a comic book fest, spent the night at some Wonder Woman’s lair. I’m sure he’ll —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Find out what or who he’s doing. Either way, Cuddy’s gonna want me to write it under “reason for termination.”

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That Kutner?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Charlotte.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: O2 sat and S-T are normal. It’s not her airway.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You’re okay.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Yeah. Don’t worry about me. She’s in pain.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pulse is rapid and regular. No fluid in her lungs.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: What’s happening?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Kutner. It’s Foreman and Thirteen.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Where are you going? House didn’t ask us to find out where he wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you wanna climb a fifth floor fire escape…

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: This might be faster.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Kutner.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Man/boy heaven. Surprised he ever leaves.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There’s nothing on his calendar. His pager’s still here.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I need an ambulance at 410 Willis. Apartment 5-C. 28-year-old male. Single gun shot wound to the right temple.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No pulse.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Alert Princeton Plainsboro. Have a trauma unit ready. His pupil’s dilated. His head’s swollen.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Still no pulse! Come on, Kutner!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Let me try.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He’s cold. Eric!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He didn’t say anything? To any of you? Family problems? Bad relationship? Financial pressures?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His parents were shot right in front of him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Parents are ancient history.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not to someone who actually cares.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He didn’t slit his wrists and… peacefully drift away. He shot himself. He didn’t leave a note. That means panic. Which could have been preempted if the idiots who worked alongside him for 80 hours a week had seen this coming.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You’re blaming us?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just trying to figure it out.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We would have helped him if he had reached out to us. He didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We should have picked up on something.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: This isn’t our fault! Something like 25% of suicidal people show no outward signs of depression.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. 25% of suicidal people have friends who didn’t notice anything and don’t want to feel guilty.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Killing himself also kills all other options. Makes Kutner an idiot. So pity, yes. But guilt, no.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That’s what you wanna tell yourself.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We still have a patient. Actually, two. One worsening, one who should be worsening.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can’t be in denial about Kutner and the husband.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It’s possible Eddie’s body is willing itself to live.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, call the tabloids. Tell them you just witnessed the miracle of slightly increased kidney function.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe we should pass this file over to another doctor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And the next one too? The one after that? How many files till it’s okay that Kutner’s dead? Cardiac enzymes means she didn’t have a heart attack. No vision problems means no mitochondrial disease.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Could be a metabolic disorder, acidosis.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Blood pH was normal. Polyserositis would inflame the membranes near her epiglottis and the heart’s pericardium, causing the chest pain.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I’ve hired a grief counselor whom I’m sure none of you will see and I’m offering time off, which I’m sure none of you will take. But just know it’s available.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Polyserositis fits. Start her on indomethacin.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: If you’d rather not deal with this case…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m fine. Despite what Wilson will say.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He hasn’t come to you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pretty sure he has mah-jongg Tuesday mornings. I assume he thinks I will work through this better if I don’t have to keep flicking his wings off my shoulder.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You didn’t even have an inkling?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know his fantasy football team cratered. Figured he’d gotten over it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well… Sorry for your loss.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thanks. But it’s not my loss.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then I’m sorry you don’t think it is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Patient’s membranes aren’t gonna heal themselves.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Taub went to run the treatment. We’d like to go see Kutner’s parents.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’ll join you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Polyserositis damages the protective covering of the tissue around the organs. The indomethacin is simply an anti-inflammatory but it should fix it.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: Just make the pain stop.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Charlotte… Close you eyes. Now… pretend you finally made it down to Rio. You’re on the balcony of a… some fancy hotel.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: You never talk like this.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Yeah, just shut up and let me do this. And you’re on that balcony, and you’re watching the Mardi Gras.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: It’s called Carnival. And I don’t wanna go without you.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I want you to. And I want it to be everything you’ve ever dreamed of.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry to interrupt… but I’d like to run one more test… on you.

utterance.speaker: Julia Kutner
utterance.content: This is the first day we got him. He was six. Sweetest little boy you ever met.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Must have been scary, going through a trauma and then being handed off to a new family.

utterance.speaker: Julia Kutner
utterance.content: We kept telling him to call us Richard and Julia. But it was always Mr. and Mrs. Kutner. And on his ninth birthday, we gave him a chemistry set. Lawrence always loved blowing things up. And he said, “Thanks, Mom. Thanks, Dad.” That’s who we were from then on.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He was pretty special. We were lucky to have him.

utterance.speaker: Julia Kutner
utterance.content: You spent the most time with him. He spoke so highly of all of you. Do you have any idea?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Wish we did. We all —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was his name. He was conflicted, didn’t know where he fit in, being ripped out of his world and stuck into yours.

utterance.speaker: Julia Kutner
utterance.content: We encouraged him to hold onto his heritage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s hard to still be Lawrence Choudhary when everyone sees you as Lawrence Kutner.

utterance.speaker: Julia Kutner
utterance.content: It was his idea to take our name.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then you should have said no.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All his Anglo name gave him was the illusion that he was someone he wasn’t. You were being emotional, not rational. You didn’t understand him.

utterance.speaker: Richard Kutner
utterance.content: We loved that boy, you son of a bitch.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You wanted to make him happy by shutting out his pain. When he looked happy, you assumed the pain had gone. It just got buried deeper, leaving him tormented about who he was until finally he put a bullet —

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House! Go back to the hospital.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m sorry about your son.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Indomethacin had no effect. She’s still in pain. Rules out polyserositis. I ran a hormone panel on Eddie. His prolactin’s above normal. Means he’s actually improving. Body chemistry changes for all sorts of reasons — stress, fear… Why not love? But maybe he’s going into some sort of remission/

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You haven’t asked if I learned anything relevant from the Kutners.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If you had, I’m sure you would have mentioned it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or you’re afraid there is something relevant. Which would mean you could have saved him.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don’t buy that suicide is always a cry for help. Sometimes you just don’t want help.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good thing you got some. Or you’d have tried again and gotten it right.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She doesn’t have Wegener’s. Kidney function’s normal. It’s not byssinosis. It’s not mitral valve stenosis. Nothing fits.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If it doesn’t fit any diagnosis, it just leaves one diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m Dr. House. You have hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. His heart is too weak. Yours is too strong. Good news is it’s fixable. We induce a massive heart attack and kill off the extra muscle.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: You wanna give me a heart attack?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s only dangerous if your heart is normal size. But since all the —

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Are you serious?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. This is actually very annoying and I’m getting really bored of lying to patients to scare them into telling me the truth. She’s faking. And yes, if she keeps faking I’m going to eventually do something that will kill her.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: How could she be… The windpipe thing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was real. Treatment made her better. But good for her was bad for you which was bad for her. So she made herself bad. It’s all so simple. She figured the sicker she was, the longer you’d hang on.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Charlotte?

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: We haven’t been this close for years. I wanted to hang on to that. Ow!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, please. People hate reruns.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: It’s my leg. I swear this is real!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What, you pinky swear or you just plain swear? Because —

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: How can she fake that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She can’t.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, what can shred an epiglottis and make muscle disappear?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Mr. and Mrs. Kutner. They caused Kutner’s death. Why not Charlotte’s?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mourning period’s over. Foreman’s sense of irony is back. I was wrong about the ethnic reason. Step one — change your name back. Step two — if step one fails — move to Bangalore. Step fourteen, if step thirteen doesn’t work, kill yourself.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So what now? You gonna insult your way through his Rolodex till you find someone with an answer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’ve been polite to the friends I’ve called. All of whom were useless.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: They weren’t useless. They just didn’t know anything more than we did.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tomato, tomah-to.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: MS. Weakens myelin sheath, compromises nerve conduction. I’m talking about Charlotte, the one who’s still alive.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You two, stick her in an MRI. Confirm MS. And you, run the echo on Eddie that you’re planning to do behind my back to see if his heart’s improving.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you let me hire a pervert?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kutner’s police background check from when he started. He was charged with indecent exposure.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Kutner streaked at the Penn-Dartmouth football game. Precisely the kind of thing you’d expect him to do. It’s okay. You should be upset. He thought like you, pushed boundaries like you —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If he thought like me, he would know that living in misery sucks marginally less than dying in it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Just a few more minutes then we’ll get you back to Eddie. What’s it like — 30 years with the same man?

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: Great for me. Good for him, I hope.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You don’t think he loves you?

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: I think he always loved me in his way, just not in a “spend time with me or show emotion or any affection for me” sort of way.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Why did you stay?

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: I didn’t need him to feel about me the way I did about him. Love… doesn’t…

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Charlotte?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I’ve heard stories of cancer patients going into spontaneous remission. You think this might be that sort of thing?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It’s unlikely, but you never know.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: If I just had a little more time… be with Charlotte, try and do better by her.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: You don’t think I mean it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I think you mean it now. I think it’s much easier to mean it than to do anything about it.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: Ha.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Chamber walls are barely moving. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He needs a friend.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I can’t deal with this and House.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You need a friend too.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You couldn’t give a crap what I need. You just want someone to take care of him.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He told Kutner’s parents it was their fault.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ruptured spleen means it’s not MS. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Waiting for you to fix her spleen so we can biopsy it for rheumatoid arthritis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’ll do it. Go home.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She’s not your patient.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And Kutner wasn’t my friend.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Kutner wanted to die. Charlotte doesn’t. So in a contest for my concern and interest, she wins.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Okay, either you’re a cold-hearted bastard or you’re too miserable to face it. Go home and cry. It’s not rheumatoid arthritis. Her liver’s scarred. Whatever she’s got, it’s spreading.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: For the record, I’m uncomfortable violating a dead colleague’s dignity.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s only violating it if you find something. Good to see you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What are we looking for?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He was hiding. Why?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Shame? Fear? Are you okay? It’s okay not to be okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: “Colonial Warrior Blaster. Number One One.” He spent months tracking this down. He had passions.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He was obviously in pain. Does it really matter why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He hung the bad with the good. His loss beside a reminder of what he’d gained. Means he was open about the pain. Should mean that if it got worse, he had no reason to hide it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Here’s how we’re going to handle this, House. We’re going to leave here and go to the closest bar and drink and tell stories about the time Kutner almost blew up an OR. And pass out in our own sick. Sound like a plan?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What am I missing? You’ve got that look. You figured this out.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You’re not here because you care about Kutner. You’re here because it’s a mystery. You’re here for the puzzle.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What if I didn’t miss anything ‘cause there’s nothing to miss? He didn’t kill himself. He was murdered.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Epiglottis, spleen and now her liver which is operating at 20% and deteriorating fast.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Autoimmne hepatitis? Did you page Foreman?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Took up Cuddy’s offer of time off. Normal thyroid means no hepatitis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Could be amyloidosis. Amyloid buildup hits the organs, tissue —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Her muscles wouldn’t have atrophied. You run the echo on the husband?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Heart’s still failing. The improvement was only temporary.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I prefer the less subtle answer: You were right, House. So… Less time proving why hubby isn’t dead, more time proving why Kutner is. Motives for murder.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: House… it was a suicide. The police have already investigated.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They investigated what they saw, not what they didn’t saw. Talk to friends, classmates, pizza delivery guy. And draft Foreman. He can make calls through his tears.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that “No, I’m not calling my boyfriend, who apparently called my boss instead of me to say he wasn’t coming in?” ‘Cause it’s really not fair to have that much subtext in one syllable.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We all want to know why Kutner did it but we’re not gonna waste time chasing ghosts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re not remotely curious?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Only why a man who embraces the rational is suddenly pursuing the irrational.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She could have alpha-1 anti-trypsin deficiency. Run her AAT proteins.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It’s too soon after your surgery.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: You can ask that someone get your organs when you die, right? Even if the donor bank turned them down?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Individual donors can bypass the registry, but there are a lot of other factors… Blood type —

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: I’ve given him blood.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It’s not just —

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: Please. If I go before him, I want you to give him my heart.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This isn’t over yet.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: For me. But it is for him, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Remy Hadley. I also answer to Thirteen. I sometimes sleep with you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I know I should have called. I just need some time.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Alone?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’ve worked through a lot of bad stuff in my life. Always done it solo.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So I should go.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: IT’s been trying to close out Kutner’s email account. Apparently someone’s still logged onto it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It wasn’t hard to figure out that his password was Kutner. He did what they tell you not to do.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He wasn’t murdered.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But his parents were. And the guy who killed them is coming up for parole.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He’s coming up for parole. He’s not out on parole.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kutner testified at every one of his hearings. The guy wouldn’t be the first to see the clock ticking.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He was killed by his own gun.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which he bought years ago, obviously for self-defense.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: In the temple. Cops found residue.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. The murderer would never try to make it look like suicide. That would be unethical. You haven’t asked about my patient.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You’re waiting on an AAT protein results.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Means you checked up to see that I’m still on it. You wanna transfer the case but you won’t because you think it’s the only thing that’s holding me together. Relax. Either I’m right or I’m wrong. We’ll know soon enough.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Find what’s killing your patient. And then I’ll find you another patient.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Nurses found her like this. She broke into the cart and injected whatever she could grab. Dumb way to look worse for Eddie.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She wasn’t trying to look worse. She was trying to kill herself.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She’s stable. But whatever was left of her liver is definitely shot now. And there’s no change in Eddie.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, thanks to her idiotic move, she’s dead in 24 hours if she doesn’t get a new liver.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It was selfless. She loves him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How does that disagree with what I just said?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Test was negative for AAT deficiency. Myelofibrosis fits but testing takes at least 48 hours.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We should try a partial donation from a live donor.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Damage is too severe. She needs a whole new liver.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No diagnosis, no liver. No liver, no living.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What do you know. It is myelofibrosis. Says so right here. Who wants to tell Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: How many times have you lied to the transplant committee?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just twice.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: How many times has it worked?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don’t quite see how that’s relevant. Cheese it. It’s the coppers.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We’re not just going to leave them to die while you fixate on Kutner.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Technically, he’s not our patient. So I’m really only leaving her to die.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We’ve already explored the usual options. Shouldn’t we at least explore unusual ones?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absolutely. Don’t worry. This is why God gave me two ears.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Kutner would say we should just come clean with Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. If only he were here to say that. I’m sure Cuddy would be bound to fall for the old, “Hey, the dead guy won’t mind if we’re wasting —”

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Need an incurable romantic to talk to an incurable romantic.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Kutner wasn’t murdered.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You deduced that by removing your sunglasses to the strains of a Who song?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Suicide means you could have helped him. Murder lets you off the hook.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Needs a liver. Has a liver. He can make a partial donation. The faster he agrees, the faster she gets to not die.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Partial won’t be enough. She needs a whole liver and he’d never survive the procedure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice symmetry, huh?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He dies on the table and you give her his whole liver.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If he’s gonna do this, he’s gonna do this for love. I though he should talk to someone who spoke the language.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: You want me to die on the table.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We don’t want you to. Your wife needs you to.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: My heart?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Is still dying. You have a couple of days at most. But this could buy us enough time to save her.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: When can I say good-bye?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You can’t. If she knew what we were planning, would she be okay?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: She’ll resent me.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She’ll be alive. Nothing else matters.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You can’t do the transplant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Only if he said no. But your urgent hovering means he said yes.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: His fingers have nodules. I think his doctors misdiagnosed him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or you sprinkled too much wishful thinking in your tea.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Obese man with lung cancer — Two easy explanations for his heart failure. Nodules can mean something else. Something curable.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go back to the ER. My thanks to you and your cold feet.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What’s going on? I’m giving you a shot at a cool result. Better yet, a chance to prove other doctors idiotic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Except you’re wrong.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You figure that out by taking off your sunglasses to the strains of a Who song?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The guy who killed Kutner’s parents died of an aneurism two months ago.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Kutner hid from everyone. You didn’t get a chance to save him. No one did. Run the tests. Find out if you have a chance to save Eddie.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bad news. Love can’t save you. On the other hand, mold can. Your heart failure was caused by a fungal infection called cardiac blastomycosis. It started as nodules in your lungs which every doc, except one, mistook for cancer. It’s very rare, very curable. I’m starting you on itraconazole.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: But how come I was getting better without the medicine?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your emotional state bumped your catecholamines which helped raise your prolactin.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: My emotional state?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Three months of treatment, you’ll be back to your buff, chiseled self.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I don’t want the treatment. Do the transplant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you’d be trading the certainty that you’ll live for the uncertainty that she’ll live.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I was ready to die anyway.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now you get to be nicer to your next wife.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: If you won’t do it, release me. And when I get hit by a car and show up in your morgue, you can give her my liver then.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You’re basically asking us to commit murder.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was yesterday too.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: There’s a difference when he has 20 years to live instead of two days.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not really. Not legally.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That’s your way of convincing us to do this, by saying it’s no more immoral?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The idiot is gonna do this with or without us. This way we can protect the organ.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We should be protecting him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So we strap him to the bed, wait till his wife dies?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I’m not doing this.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I will. We’ve already had one pointless death.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: Eddie, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: I don’t know. He just came and got me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Your husband has a curable disease, but he wants to die so he can give you his liver. Are you okay with that or would you rather he take the treatment?

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: You son of a bitch!

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: Eddie, don’t!

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: You have to let me do this.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Charlotte, can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She spiked a fever. LP shows her white cells through the roof. She’s infected everywhere.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I should fire you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Just did what you failed to do, convince Eddie to live and let his wife die.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Infection means we have a new clue.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And a full two or three hours to figure it out.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Sarcoidosis hits the spleen and the liver.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She would have lung issues.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Scleroderma inflames the tissue.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No skin or GI problems. What is she hiding?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You don’t know that —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Either we have all the clues and we’re idiots or we don’t have all the clues.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Possible exposure, people, places.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Both.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bad lie. Did you really think the beaches in Hawaii were just like the beaches in Rio? The disease bearing sand flies are completely different.

utterance.speaker: Eddie
utterance.content: She’s never been to Rio.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who’d you go with?

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: Why are you doing this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don’t actually need to know who it was. I just need to know that you went so we can know that you have visceral leishmaniasis. But since Lancelot there was ready to die for you, he might want the answer to both.

utterance.speaker: Charlotte
utterance.content: Last year… It was nobody you know. Rio was supposed to be ours. I got tired of waiting. I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Start her on antimony and have Cuddy find her a liver. They were ready to die. But for guilt, not love.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You can’t feel that much guilt without love.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: New York Mercy’s medevacing the liver. It should be here…

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Tell them to turn around. Charlotte’s treatment isn’t taking. We diagnosed it too late.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Everyone’s heading over to Kutner’s funeral. You’re welcome to ride with me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I’m gonna stay with Charlotte.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She bought you some time to save Eddie. It’ll give her death some meaning.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. It won’t.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was wrong about you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, you weren’t.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You’re in pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you’re romanticizing. Again.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You worked with him every day for two years and you never saw this coming.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No one saw it coming.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: But you see everything coming. This has never been about what you missed. This is about why you missed it. You’re terrified that you’re losing your gift, losing… who you are. And I’m terrified of what you’d do then.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unless you feel there’s more to do here to cure me, don’t you have a funeral to go to?
